City Council
============

2. [Government](https://cityofjosephinetx.com/government/)
3. City Council

![city-council](https://cityofjosephinetx.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/City-Council.webp "City Council")

City Council
------------

The City of Josephine is a Type A General Law Municipality utilizing a Mayor-City Council form of government.

The purpose of the government of the City of Josephine is to provide responsible leadership and the services necessary to achieve a safe environment and high quality of life for our citizens.

![Council Meetings](https://cityofjosephinetx.com/wp-content/themes/smartwp/assets/images/place holder_fill.svg "Council Meetings")Council Meetings

City Council meetings are held on the second Monday of every month at 6 p.m. at the Josephine City Hall located at 201 Main Street, next to the Josephine Post Office. Meetings are open to the public and an agenda is posted at City Hall, the Post Office, City Park Bulletin Board and on the city website on our [Agendas & Minutes page](https://cityofjosephinetx.com/government/agendas-minutes/ "Agendas & Minutes") 72 hours prior to the meeting.

Citizen‚Äôs Comment

The Josephine City Council invites residents to share their thoughts during any City Council Meeting.

![üí¨](https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/17.0.2/svg/1f4ac.svg)¬†**Citizen Comments:**  
![üîπ](https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/17.0.2/svg/1f539.svg)¬†Citizens may address the Council on items not on the agenda.  
![üîπ](https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/17.0.2/svg/1f539.svg)¬†If you wish to speak on an agenda item, you may do so during citizen comments or wait until the item is considered.  
![üîπ](https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/17.0.2/svg/1f539.svg)¬†**How to Speak:**¬†Attend the meeting and fill out a speaker card. You will be called to the podium when it‚Äôs your turn.  
![üîπ](https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/17.0.2/svg/1f539.svg)¬†Each speaker will have up to 3 minutes and must state their address for the record.  
![üîπ](https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/17.0.2/svg/1f539.svg)¬†Due to state law, the Council cannot discuss or act on items not listed on the agenda, but may:  
![‚úîÔ∏è](https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/17.0.2/svg/2714.svg)¬†Provide factual information.  
![‚úîÔ∏è](https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/17.0.2/svg/2714.svg)¬†Recite existing policy.  
![‚úîÔ∏è](https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/17.0.2/svg/2714.svg)¬†Consider adding the item to a future agenda.

Your voice matters‚Äîjoin us and be part of the conversation! ![üèôÔ∏è](https://s.w.org/images/core/emoji/17.0.2/svg/1f3d9.svg)

Frequently Asked Questions
--------------------------

Josephine is a fast-growing community located just east of DFW Metroplex, home to A-rated schools and a small-town, country atmosphere.

How to Sign up for the Utility Billing portal?
----------------------------------------------

**Go to [www.cityofjosephinetx.com](http://www.cityofjosephinetx.com/)**

* - Click Pay Water Bill
* - Click Sign in or Sign up
* - Click Register
* - Enter the email and password you would like to use for your login
* - It will send you an email to the email address you provided to verify the email address.
* - Go to the email it sent you and activate /verify your email
* - Login to the portal with the email address and password you signed up with
* - Click on Add to my service under additional links
* - Click on Utility Billing
* - Click on add account
* - Enter the account number including the dashes
* - Enter you last payment amount excluding the dollar sign. If you have not made a payment you will need to put zero.

When is my utility bill due?
----------------------------

Utility bills are available by the 1st on the portal every month and are due by the 15th every month. A $20 late charge is added the following business day if not paid in full. If the 15th falls on a weekend or holiday you will have until the following business day at 8 a.m. to submit a payment. Your water meter is read the week of the 20th of each month. ¬†Any unpaid balance not paid in full by the 25th of the month will result in disconnection of service the following business day.

How do I pay my utility bill?
-----------------------------

* Online Portal
  + You will need your account number and last payment amount
  + This is where you can sign up for auto pay

* Call the secure phone line to pay (877) 881-0113
  + You will need your account number and service address
* Cash, check, or money order to avoid processing fees
  + You can utilize bill pay through your bank if your bank has that capability. Utilizing bill pay can take up to 2-3 business days for the city to receive payment.
  + You may utilize the city drop box located at City Hall 201 Main Street
* ACH Bank Draft
  + Your utility bill will be drafted on the 10th of each month or the following business day if the 10th is a weekend or holiday. This is a FREE way to pay. You must complete the bank draft authorization form on the water department page.

What are the current water restrictions in our area?
----------------------------------------------------

April 1 - October 31 Stage 1 Water Conservation. Please see watering schedule on Utility Department page.

What do I do if I have a water or sewer emergency?
--------------------------------------------------

Call City Hall if the issue is between 8:30 A.M. - 4:30 P.M. Monday-Friday. If it is outside that time frame, please call the emergency after hours line [(972) 989-5254](tel:972-989-5254 "(972) 989-5254").

What do I do if my sewer is backing up into my house?
-----------------------------------------------------

Call City Hall if the issue is between 8:30-4:30pm Monday - Friday. Call the emergency after hours line if it any other time.

Does the city offer leak adjustments?
-------------------------------------

Yes, each resident is allowed one leak adjustment per 12 months. Here is the link for the form: [LEAK ADJUSTMENT REQUEST](https://cityofjosephinetx.com/leak-adjustment-request/) You may also come into city hall to fill out the form.

What do I do if I have a leak?
------------------------------

You would want to call a plumber to get the leak fixed as soon as possible. Then complete a leak adjustment request form on the utility department page on the city website or come into city hall to fill out the form.
